name: Morning Glory
climate: Thrives in warm, temperate climates with plenty of sunshine.
Can also adapt to subtropical regions when given proper care.
Not suitable for very cold climates or hard frosts, must be protected.
Requires a climate that allows for at least a few months of warm weather.
sunlight: Requires full sun exposure for at least six hours a day to thrive.
Can tolerate partial shade but will not flower as prolifically.
Sunlight encourages vigorous growth and abundant blooming.
Too little sunlight may result in poor flowering and lanky growth.
watering: Needs regular watering, especially during dry and hot periods.
Soil should be kept consistently moist but not waterlogged.
Will need less frequent watering once established and growing well.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so ensure proper drainage.
soil: Performs best in well-draining, moderately fertile soil types.
Prefers soil that retains some moisture but is not too heavy.
Can tolerate poor soil conditions if water and light are sufficient.
Slightly acidic to neutral soil pH is preferred for optimal growth.
toxic: Seeds contain toxic compounds that are harmful if ingested by humans or pets.
extra_care_tip: Consider providing a trellis or support as they are climbing plants.
